entries.title: Company Name
entries.definition: The official name of this organization in our CRM. This is the primary identifier used across all records, reports, and communications.

entries.title: Company Domain Name
entries.definition:
The unique web domain associated with this company (e.g., acme.com). This field is used to:

  • Automatically associate contacts via email domain matching
  • Identify and deduplicate company records
  • Enrich company data from third-party sources

entries.title: Company Owner
entries.definition: The team member responsible for managing the relationship with this company. The owner receives notifications, appears in activity reports, and is the primary point of contact for all dealings with this account.

entries.title: Industry
entries.definition: The primary business sector this company operates in. Use this to segment accounts for targeted campaigns, assign to specialized team members, and analyze performance by market vertical.

entries.title: Lifecycle Stage
entries.definition:
Where this company stands in our sales and marketing journey. Stages progress from initial awareness through to becoming a customer:

  • Subscriber - Opted in to communications
  • Lead - Shown interest, needs qualification
  • MQL - Marketing has qualified as sales-ready
  • SQL - Sales has accepted and is actively working
  • Opportunity - Has an active deal in pipeline
  • Customer - Closed-won business
  • Evangelist - Active promoter of our brand

entries.title: Lead Status
entries.definition: The current sales outreach status for this company. Use this to track where accounts are in our prospecting workflow, from initial outreach through qualification to either conversion or disqualification.

entries.title: Number of Employees
entries.definition:
The total headcount at this organization. This metric helps us:

  • Segment accounts by company size
  • Qualify opportunities based on fit criteria
  • Tailor messaging and pricing appropriately

entries.title: Annual Revenue
entries.definition: The company's estimated yearly revenue. This data point is crucial for account scoring, territory assignment, and ensuring our team focuses on accounts that match our ideal customer profile.

entries.title: Create Date
entries.definition: When this company record was first added to our CRM. Use this to track pipeline growth over time and measure how long companies spend in each stage of our funnel.

entries.title: Last Activity Date
entries.definition: The most recent date when any engagement was logged on this company record, including calls, emails, meetings, notes, or tasks. Monitor this to identify accounts that may need re-engagement or follow-up.

entries.title: Last Contacted
entries.definition: When our team last reached out to this company via a direct communication channel (call, email, meeting, or chat). This excludes automated marketing touches and helps us track genuine sales engagement.

entries.title: Number of Associated Contacts
entries.definition: How many individual contacts from this company exist in our CRM. A higher count often indicates deeper penetration into the account and better relationship mapping across the organization.

entries.title: Number of Associated Deals
entries.definition: The total number of deals (opportunities) linked to this company, including open and closed deals. Use this to understand the full revenue relationship and potential with this account.

entries.title: Total Revenue
entries.definition: The cumulative value of all closed-won deals with this company. This represents the actual revenue generated from this account and is key for identifying our most valuable customers.

entries.title: Target Account
entries.definition: Marks this company as a priority account in our account-based marketing (ABM) strategy. Target accounts receive focused attention from both sales and marketing teams to drive engagement and conversion.

entries.title: Ideal Customer Profile Tier
entries.definition: How closely this company matches our ideal customer profile, with Tier 1 being the closest fit. Use this to prioritize outreach and allocate resources to accounts most likely to convert and succeed.

entries.title: Phone Number
entries.definition: The primary phone number for reaching this company. Ensure this is kept current to enable efficient outreach and quick contact when opportunities arise.

entries.title: Website URL
entries.definition: The company's web address. When populated, this also fills in the Company Domain Name field. Use this for quick access to research the company and understand their business.

entries.title: Description
entries.definition: A brief summary of what this company does, their mission, and their market position. Keep this updated to help our team quickly understand the account context.

entries.title: Type
entries.definition: Classifies our relationship with this company (e.g., Prospect, Customer, Partner, Vendor). Use this to segment our database and tailor our approach based on the nature of the relationship.

entries.title: City
entries.definition: The city where this company's primary office is located. Use with other location fields for territory assignment and regional analysis.

entries.title: State/Region
entries.definition: The state, province, or region where this company is headquartered. Essential for territory management and regional reporting.

entries.title: Country/Region
entries.definition: The country where this company operates. Use for geographic segmentation, compliance considerations, and assigning accounts to region-specific teams.

entries.title: Record Source
entries.definition: How this company record was originally created (e.g., Import, Form Submission, API, Manual Entry). Understanding record sources helps us evaluate which channels are generating the best leads.

entries.title: Last Modified Date
entries.definition: When any property on this company record was last changed. This includes both manual edits and automated updates, helping us identify recently active records.

entries.title: Owner Assigned Date
entries.definition: When the current owner was assigned to this company. Use this to measure response times and ensure new accounts are being worked promptly after assignment.

entries.title: Next Activity Date
entries.definition: The scheduled date of the next planned engagement with this company. Keep this populated to ensure consistent follow-up and prevent accounts from falling through the cracks.

entries.title: LinkedIn Company Page
entries.definition: The URL to this company's LinkedIn profile. Use for research, social selling, and staying informed about company news and updates.

entries.title: Facebook Company Page
entries.definition: The URL to this company's Facebook page. Helpful for understanding their brand presence and engaging with their content.

entries.title: Original Traffic Source
entries.definition: The marketing channel that first drove a contact from this company to our website (e.g., Organic Search, Paid Ads, Referral). Attribute company acquisition to the right marketing efforts.

entries.title: Days to Close
entries.definition: The number of days between when this company was created and when they became a customer. Use this metric to benchmark sales cycle performance and identify bottlenecks.

entries.title: Record ID
entries.definition: The unique identifier for this company record in our CRM. Use this for imports, API integrations, and when we need to reference a specific record unambiguously.

entries.title: Parent Company
entries.definition: Links this company to its parent organization, creating a corporate hierarchy. Use this to understand complex organizational structures and roll up reporting across subsidiaries.

entries.title: Number of Open Deals
entries.definition: How many deals are currently in progress with this company (not yet closed-won or closed-lost). Indicates active sales engagement and pipeline value at risk.

entries.title: Recent Deal Amount
entries.definition: The value of the most recently closed-won deal with this company. Helps us understand recent purchasing patterns and set expectations for future deals.

entries.title: Recent Deal Close Date
entries.definition: When the most recent deal with this company was closed as won. Use to identify customers who may be ready for upsell or expansion conversations.

entries.title: First Name
entries.definition: The contact's given name. Used for personalization in emails, communications, and to help our team address contacts appropriately.

entries.title: Last Name
entries.definition: The contact's family name or surname. Combined with first name for full identification and formal communications.

entries.title: Email
entries.definition:
The contact's primary email address. This is the main identifier for contacts and is used for:

  • Deduplication and record matching
  • All email communications
  • Automatic company association via domain

entries.title: Contact Owner
entries.definition: The team member responsible for this contact relationship. The owner receives activity notifications, appears in reports, and is accountable for moving this contact through the sales process.

entries.title: Job Title
entries.definition:
The contact's role within their organization. Essential for:

  • Identifying decision-makers and influencers
  • Tailoring messaging to their responsibilities
  • Qualifying opportunities based on authority

entries.title: Phone Number
entries.definition: The contact's primary phone number. Keep this current to enable direct outreach when email isn't the right channel or when we need an immediate response.

entries.title: Mobile Phone Number
entries.definition: The contact's mobile/cell phone number. Useful for reaching contacts outside office hours or for SMS communications where enabled.

entries.title: Lifecycle Stage
entries.definition:
Where this contact stands in our marketing and sales journey:

  • Subscriber - Opted in to receive communications
  • Lead - Has shown interest, needs qualification
  • MQL - Marketing qualified, ready for sales
  • SQL - Sales accepted and actively working
  • Opportunity - Associated with an active deal
  • Customer - Has a closed-won deal
  • Evangelist - Actively promotes our brand

entries.title: Lead Status
entries.definition: The contact's current position in our sales outreach process. Tracks progression from initial contact through qualification, helping our team know exactly where to focus their efforts.

entries.title: Company Name
entries.definition: The name of the organization this contact works for. Note: This is a separate field from the associated company record and can be manually updated regardless of company associations.

entries.title: Create Date
entries.definition: When this contact was first added to our CRM. Use this to track lead generation over time and measure how long contacts spend in each funnel stage.

entries.title: Last Activity Date
entries.definition: When the most recent engagement occurred on this contact's record (calls, emails, meetings, notes, or tasks). Monitor this to identify contacts who may need re-engagement.

entries.title: Last Contacted
entries.definition: The date and time of our most recent direct communication with this contact (call, email, meeting, or chat). Excludes automated marketing and helps track genuine engagement.

entries.title: HubSpot Score
entries.definition: A numerical score indicating this contact's sales readiness, calculated based on criteria we've defined. Higher scores suggest stronger qualification based on demographics, behaviors, and engagement patterns.

entries.title: Number of Times Contacted
entries.definition: How many direct communications have been logged with this contact (calls, emails, meetings, messages). Use to gauge engagement depth and avoid over-contacting prospects.

entries.title: Number of Sales Activities
entries.definition: The total count of all sales activities logged on this contact, including calls, emails, meetings, notes, and tasks. Measures overall sales engagement effort.

entries.title: Original Traffic Source
entries.definition: The marketing channel that first brought this contact to our website (e.g., Organic Search, Paid Ads, Social Media, Referral). Critical for attributing lead generation to the right campaigns.

entries.title: Latest Traffic Source
entries.definition: The most recent marketing channel through which this contact interacted with our business. Helps us understand ongoing engagement patterns and which channels keep contacts coming back.

entries.title: First Conversion
entries.definition: The first form this contact submitted, displayed as the page title followed by the form name. Tells us how this contact initially engaged with our content.

entries.title: First Conversion Date
entries.definition: When this contact first submitted a form on our website. Marks the beginning of their engagement journey with our brand.

entries.title: Recent Conversion
entries.definition: The most recent form this contact submitted. Shows their latest point of engagement and what content or offers they're currently interested in.

entries.title: Recent Conversion Date
entries.definition: When this contact last submitted a form. A recent date indicates active engagement; a distant date may signal the need for re-engagement.

entries.title: Number of Form Submissions
entries.definition: How many forms this contact has submitted, including marketing forms and meeting scheduling pages. Higher numbers indicate stronger engagement with our content.

entries.title: City
entries.definition: The city where this contact is located. Useful for territory assignment, local event invitations, and geographic segmentation.

entries.title: State/Region
entries.definition: The state, province, or region where this contact resides. Essential for regional campaigns and territory-based routing.

entries.title: Country/Region
entries.definition: The country where this contact is located. Important for international compliance, language preferences, and assigning to region-specific teams.

entries.title: Marketing Emails Opened
entries.definition: The count of unique marketing emails this contact has opened. A key engagement metric showing how interested this contact is in our communications.

entries.title: Marketing Emails Clicked
entries.definition: How many marketing emails this contact has clicked links in. Clicks indicate deeper engagement than opens and suggest genuine interest in our content.

entries.title: Unsubscribed from All Email
entries.definition: Indicates this contact has opted out of all email communications from our account. Respect this preference to maintain compliance and brand reputation.

entries.title: Number of Page Views
entries.definition: The total pages this contact has viewed on our website. Higher page views indicate stronger interest and deeper research into our products or services.

entries.title: Number of Sessions
entries.definition: How many separate browsing sessions this contact has had on our website. Multiple sessions over time show sustained interest and return engagement.

entries.title: Time First Seen
entries.definition: When this contact first visited our website. Marks the beginning of their digital engagement with our brand, even before they converted.

entries.title: Time Last Seen
entries.definition: The most recent time this contact viewed a page on our website. Recent activity suggests active interest; dormant contacts may need nurturing.

entries.title: Close Date
entries.definition: When this contact became a customer. Automatically set when an associated deal closes as won (if lifecycle stage syncing is enabled). Essential for measuring sales velocity.

entries.title: Days to Close
entries.definition: The number of days between when this contact was created and when they became a customer. Benchmark against averages to identify fast-moving or stalled opportunities.

entries.title: Total Revenue
entries.definition: The cumulative dollar value of all closed-won deals associated with this contact. Identifies our most valuable customers and helps prioritize relationship investment.

entries.title: Number of Associated Deals
entries.definition: How many deals (opportunities) are linked to this contact. Shows the breadth of business relationship and potential for future opportunities.

entries.title: Buying Role
entries.definition: The part this contact plays in purchasing decisions (e.g., Decision Maker, Budget Holder, Champion, Influencer, End User). Map buying committees by assigning roles to all stakeholders.

entries.title: Record ID
entries.definition: The unique identifier for this contact in our CRM. Use for imports, API integrations, and when we need to reference this specific record.

entries.title: Record Source
entries.definition: How this contact record was originally created (e.g., Form, Import, API, Manual). Understanding sources helps us evaluate lead generation channels.

entries.title: Last Modified Date
entries.definition: When any property on this contact was last changed. Helps identify recently active records and track data freshness.

entries.title: Owner Assigned Date
entries.definition: When the current owner was assigned to this contact. Measure response times by comparing this to subsequent activity dates.

entries.title: Next Activity Date
entries.definition: The date of the next planned engagement with this contact. Ensure this is always populated for active leads to maintain consistent follow-up.

entries.title: Contact Unworked
entries.definition: Indicates the contact has not been actively worked - either no owner is assigned, or no sales activity has been logged since ownership was assigned. Use to identify leads that need attention.

entries.title: LinkedIn URL
entries.definition: The URL to this contact's LinkedIn profile. Invaluable for social selling, research, and understanding the contact's professional background.

entries.title: Persona
entries.definition: The buyer persona this contact fits into. Use personas to segment our database and deliver targeted content that resonates with each audience type.

entries.title: Marketing Contact Status
entries.definition: Whether this contact is classified as a marketing contact (counts toward our subscription limit and can receive marketing emails) or non-marketing contact.

entries.title: Last Engagement Date
entries.definition: When this contact last engaged with our business through actions like opening emails, clicking links, booking meetings, or submitting forms. Requires an assigned owner to be tracked.

entries.title: Deal Name
entries.definition: The name we've given this deal or opportunity. Make it descriptive enough that anyone on our team can understand what this opportunity is about at a glance.

entries.title: Deal Stage
entries.definition: Where this deal currently sits in our sales pipeline. Each stage represents a milestone in our sales process, with movement through stages indicating progress toward closing.

entries.title: Pipeline
entries.definition: Which sales pipeline this deal belongs to. Different pipelines can represent different products, services, or sales processes. The pipeline determines which stages are available.

entries.title: Deal Owner
entries.definition: The team member responsible for closing this deal. The owner drives all sales activities, manages the relationship, and is accountable for the outcome.

entries.title: Amount
entries.definition: The total monetary value of this deal. This is the primary metric for pipeline reporting, forecasting, and measuring sales performance.

entries.title: Close Date
entries.definition: When we expect this deal to close. Keep this accurate for reliable forecasting - update it as the deal progresses and we have better visibility into timing.

entries.title: Create Date
entries.definition: When this deal was first created in our CRM. Used to measure pipeline generation and calculate sales cycle length from creation to close.

entries.title: Deal Type
entries.definition: The category of business this deal represents (e.g., New Business, Existing Business, Renewal). Use to segment pipeline reporting and track performance by deal type.

entries.title: Priority
entries.definition: The level of attention this deal requires. Use priority to help our team focus on the most important opportunities and allocate resources appropriately.

entries.title: Closed Lost Reason
entries.definition: Why this deal was lost. Capturing accurate loss reasons is critical for improving our sales process, addressing competitive gaps, and reducing future losses.

entries.title: Closed Won Reason
entries.definition: The primary factor that led to winning this deal. Understanding win patterns helps us replicate success and refine our value proposition.

entries.title: Deal Description
entries.definition: A summary of what this deal involves. Include context that helps our team understand the opportunity - customer needs, solution proposed, and any special circumstances.

entries.title: Next Step
entries.definition: The immediate next action required to move this deal forward. Keep this current so anyone reviewing the deal knows exactly what needs to happen next.

entries.title: Last Activity Date
entries.definition: When the most recent engagement occurred on this deal (calls, emails, meetings, notes). Deals with no recent activity may be at risk of stalling.

entries.title: Last Contacted
entries.definition: When we last had a direct communication with stakeholders on this deal. Monitor this to ensure deals don't go cold due to lack of engagement.

entries.title: Next Activity Date
entries.definition: The date of the next planned action on this deal. Every active deal should have a next activity scheduled to maintain momentum.

entries.title: Number of Associated Contacts
entries.definition: How many contacts are linked to this deal. More contacts typically indicates better relationship mapping and multi-threading within the account.

entries.title: Is Closed Won
entries.definition: Indicates this deal has been successfully closed. Use this to filter and report on our wins and calculate win rates.

entries.title: Is Closed Lost
entries.definition: Indicates this deal was lost and is no longer active. Analyze lost deals to identify patterns and improve our win rate over time.

entries.title: Currency
entries.definition: The currency in which this deal's amount is denominated. Important for global sales teams dealing in multiple currencies.

entries.title: Amount in Company Currency
entries.definition: The deal value converted to our company's base currency. Enables accurate pipeline and revenue reporting across deals in different currencies.

entries.title: Annual Contract Value
entries.definition: The yearly value of this deal, useful for subscription or recurring revenue businesses. Normalizes deal values for comparison regardless of contract length.

entries.title: Date Entered Current Stage
entries.definition: When this deal moved into its current pipeline stage. Use to identify deals that have been in one stage too long and may need intervention.

entries.title: Time in Current Stage
entries.definition: How long this deal has been in its current stage. Compare against benchmarks to identify deals that may be stuck or at risk.

entries.title: Deal Status
entries.definition: A simplified grouping of deals into Won, Lost, or Open (all other stages). Useful for quick filtering and high-level pipeline views.

entries.title: Record ID
entries.definition: The unique identifier for this deal in our CRM. Use for imports, API integrations, and referencing specific deals unambiguously.

entries.title: Record Source
entries.definition: How this deal was originally created (e.g., Manual, Import, API, Workflow). Understanding sources helps us track which processes generate pipeline.

entries.title: Last Modified Date
entries.definition: When any property on this deal was last changed. Helps identify recently worked deals and track data freshness across our pipeline.

entries.title: Owner Assigned Date
entries.definition: When the current owner was assigned to this deal. Measure response times and ensure deals are being actively worked after assignment.

entries.title: HubSpot Team
entries.definition: The primary team of the deal owner. Enables team-based pipeline reporting and helps managers track their team's performance.

entries.title: Original Traffic Source
entries.definition: The marketing channel that first brought an associated contact to our website. Attribute revenue to the marketing efforts that generated the opportunity.

entries.title: Latest Traffic Source
entries.definition: The most recent marketing channel through which associated contacts interacted with our business. Shows which channels influence deals already in pipeline.

entries.title: Days to Close
entries.definition: The number of days between deal creation and close date. Compare against benchmarks to identify unusually long or short sales cycles.

entries.title: Forecast Category
entries.definition: Groups deals for forecasting purposes (e.g., Commit, Best Case, Pipeline). Helps sales leaders build accurate forecasts by categorizing deal likelihood.

entries.title: Forecast Probability
entries.definition: The estimated likelihood this deal will close as won. Use historical data and deal characteristics to set realistic probabilities for accurate forecasting.

entries.title: Merged Deal IDs
entries.definition: The Record IDs of any deals that were merged into this one. Helps track deal consolidation history when duplicate opportunities are combined.

entries.title: Next Meeting Start Time
entries.definition: When the next scheduled meeting for this deal begins. Having upcoming meetings booked indicates active engagement and deal momentum.

entries.title: Is Stalled After Timestamp
entries.definition: When this deal was flagged as potentially stalled - meaning time in the current stage exceeds 20% longer than average for closed-won deals. Indicates the deal may need intervention.

entries.title: Recurring Revenue Amount
entries.definition: The recurring revenue value associated with this deal. Critical for subscription businesses to track and forecast predictable revenue.

entries.title: Recurring Revenue Deal Type
entries.definition: The category of recurring revenue this deal represents: New Business, Renewal, Upgrade, or Downgrade. Essential for analyzing revenue composition and trends.
